    public class DblArray1CMaker

    • Method Detail

      • createRandomChromosome

        public java.lang.Object createRandomChromosome(java.util.Hashtable params)
                                        throws OptimizerException
        creates and returns a double[] object with length equal to the (Integer) value mapped to the key "dea.chromosomelength" in the params argument passed in, and also obeying the following bounding box constraints:
      • <"dea.minallelevalue", Double v> optional, the min. value that any component of the returned vector may assume
      • <"dea.maxallelevalue", Double v> optional, the max. value that any component of the returned vector may assume
      • <"dea.minallelevalue"+$i$, Double v> optional, the min. value that the i-th comp. of the returned vector may assume (i={0,1,...nd.intValue()-1})
      • <"dea.maxallelevalue"+$i$, Double v> optional, the max. value that the i-th comp. of the returned vector may assume (i={0,1,...nd.intValue()-1}) The "local" constraints can only impose more strict constraints on the variables, but cannot be used to "over-ride" a global constraint to make the domain of the variable wider.
Specified by:
createRandomChromosome in interface RandomChromosomeMakerIntf
Parameters:
params - Hashtable
Returns:
Object an int[]
Throws:
OptimizerException - if the mandatory parameters are not passed in
